syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Chemistry 9701

learning_objectives.description: explain the lack of reactivity of nitrogen, with reference to triple bond strength and lack of polarity

describe and explain: (a) the basicity of ammonia, using the Brønsted–Lowry theory (b) the structure of the ammonium ion and its formation by an acid-base reaction (c) the displacement of ammonia from ammonium salts by an acid-base reaction
state and explain the natural and man-made occurrences of oxides of nitrogen and their catalytic removal from the exhaust gases of internal combustion engines
understand that atmospheric oxides of nitrogen (NO and NO₂) can react with unburned hydrocarbons to form peroxyacetyl nitrate, PAN, which is a component of photochemical smog
describe the role of NO and NO₂ in the formation of acid rain both directly and in their catalytic role in the oxidation of atmospheric sulfur dioxide
